sys::Thread Class Reference

Documentation

This class creates and manages new threads using POSIX calls.

Public Member Functions

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

sys::Thread::Thread ( int  stack_size = 4096,
bool  detached = true 
)

This constructs a new thread object

Parameters
stack_sizeThe stack size of the new thread (default is 4096)
detachedWhether to create as a detached thread. If this value is false, another thread must use join() in order for the thread to terminate correctly.

static int sys::Thread::join ( int  ident,
void **  value_ptr 
)
static

Join the current thread to the specified thread

Parameters
identthe ID of the target thread
value_ptrA pointer to the return value of the target thread
Returns
Zero on success
void sys::Thread::reset ( )
inline

Reset the object (thread must not be running)

enum Sched::policy  value,
int  priority 
)
static

Set the scheduler

Parameters
pidThe process ID
valueThe polic (such as Sched::FIFO)
priorityThe priority (higher is higher priority)
Returns
Zero on success of -1 with errno set
int sys::Thread::set_stacksize ( int  size)

Sets the stacksize (no effect after create)

int sys::Thread::wait ( void **  ret,
int  interval = 1000 
)

Wait for the thread to complete (joins thread if it is not detached)

static void sys::Thread::yield ( )
static

Yield the processor to another thread
